body_html:
The root cause of this particular error was that libasan.so was not installed in a place the dynamic linker could find (but the compiler knew where it was), so compilation succeeded but running failed. However, the "does the compiler work at all" test only checks if a compile succeeds, and then we proceed on the assumption that "of course running will work."

The error itself doesn't show up in the log, perhaps because it seems cmake is not capturing stderr (https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/17745). It's very obvious if you run the command by hand. I also have a fix for this.

The root cause of this particular error was that `libasan.so` was not installed in a place the dynamic linker could find (but the compiler knew where it was), so compilation succeeded but running failed. However, the "does the compiler work at all" test only checks if a compile succeeds, and then we proceed on the assumption that "of course running will work."

The error itself doesn't show up in the log, perhaps because it seems cmake is not capturing stderr (https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/17745). It's very obvious if you run the command by hand. I also have a fix for this.
